intro: Chamaesyce aureola, commonly known as golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy appearance. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chamaesyce aureola typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks.
